com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.sample

Class NotificationSample

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datamirror.ts.target.publication.userexit.sample.NotificationSample
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlertHandlerIF

    public class NotificationSample
extends java.lang.Object
implements AlertHandlerIF
    An example Notification user exit

    To compile the user exit class, make sure <install>\lib\ts.jar is included in the classpath.

    To run the user exit, the compiled class files must be in the correct package folder referenced by the classpath when transformation server was started.

    Use trial and error to identify the zone, category, and event ids of interest. The Management Console event log and e-mail event handlers can assist in identifying the range of values that are of interest.

      • handle

        public void handle(int p_zoneid,
                   int p_categoryid,
                   java.lang.String sourceOrTarget,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   int eventID,
                   java.lang.String eventText,
                   java.util.Properties otherInfo)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Example implementation of the AlertHandlerIF.handle() API

        This example code illustrates two things:

        • Converting the parameter values to human readable strings
        • Executing a unix shell script when a specific event occurs
        Specified by:
        handle in interface AlertHandlerIF
        Parameters:
        p_zoneid - zone ID
        p_categoryid - category ID
        sourceOrTarget - source or target
        name - name
        eventID - event ID
        eventText - The English event message
        otherInfo - other info
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception
